org.streaminer.stream.quantile

Class SimpleQuantiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.stream.quantile.SimpleQuantiles
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQuantiles<Double>

    public class SimpleQuantiles
extends Object
implements IQuantiles<Double>
    This implementation computes approximate phi-quantiles that differ at most epsilon*N ranks from the element that is the real quantile. epsilon is known a priori and affects N, which is the minimum size of the set of observations. To get a hunch how many examples are need I'm providing some examples:
    • epsilon = 0.25 - buffer size = 48
    • epsilon = 0.10 - buffer size = 100
    • epsilon = 0.05 - buffer size = 190
    • epsilon = 0.01 - buffer size = 910
    You can use this class to estimate quantiles, as long as the distribution of observations doesn't have a heavy tail.
    Author:
    Markus Kokott

      • isInInitialPhase

        public boolean isInInitialPhase()
        Before a quantile can be computed, the first buffer has to be filled. During that initial phase every call of getQuantile(double) will return Double.NaN. You can call this method to check whether the initial phase has ended or not.
        Returns:
        true if no quantiles can be computed at the moment.
